creator: twh@iw.net
text:
In testing an httpd instance with multiple piped logs, all the log 
processes get restarted after being killed -- except the one for 
the ErrorLog.

I have reproduced the problem on both AIX 5.2 and Novell Linux Desktop.
 
APR configuration:
--enable-threads --enable-other-child --enable-nonportable-atomics

HTTPD configuration:
--enable-so --enable-mods-shared=all

creator: twh@iw.net
text:
Created attachment 14768
this patch updates open_error_log() to use ap_open_piped_log()

in server/log.c, open_error_log() is using log_child() rather than the more
"reliable" (depending on configuration of course) ap_open_piped_log().
This patch fixed the problem on both AIX and Linux and the ErrorLog piped log
program now gets restarted properly when killed/crashed etc.
* There may be a good reason that I'm not aware of for not using
ap_open_piped_log() here.

While I don't believe this is MPM specific, httpd was configured with the worker
mpm.
